## Used Technologies

### Biome

The project use Biome to lint and format the code.

<small class="text-primary font-bold text-sm">_Why use Biome?_</small>

- Biome is about **35x faster** than Prettier

- Avoid obscure error messages, when we tell you something is wrong, they tell
  you exactly where the problem is and how to fix it.

- Out of the box support for all the language features you use today. First
  class support for TypeScript and JSX.

- With tight internal integration they are able to reuse previous work and any
  improvement to one tool improves them all.

<LinkButton href="https://biomejs.dev/" variant={"outline"}>
  Biome Documentation
</LinkButton>

### Ky for HTTP requests

The project use Ky to HTTP requests.

<small class="text-primary font-bold text-sm">_Why use Ky?_</small>

- Method shortcuts (ky.post())

- Treats non-2xx status codes as errors (after redirects)

- Timeout support

- URL prefix option

- Hooks

- Retries failed requests

<LinkButton href="https://github.com/sindresorhus/ky" variant={"outline"}>
  Ky Repository
</LinkButton>

### Shadcn UI

The project uses Shadcn to build UI components.

<small class="text-primary font-bold text-sm">_Why use Shadcn UI?_</small>

- Copy and paste components

- Based on radix and totally customizable and aceppt changes

- _**In a few days I'll change to [Kanpeki UI](https://kanpeki.vercel.app/). It's way better than Shadcn, it offers accessible components with all properties and some useful hooks to improve the user experience**_

<LinkButton href="https://ui.shadcn.com/" variant={"outline"}>
  Shadcn Website
</LinkButton>

### Zod

The project uses Zod for validation.

<small class="text-primary font-bold text-sm">_Why use Zod?_</small>

- Enhancing type safety at runtime

- infer the type from the data schemas you define

- display errors at runtime during user interactions with the UI

<LinkButton href="https://zod.dev/" variant={"outline"}>
  Zod Documentation
</LinkButton>

### @t3-oss/env-nextjs

The project uses t3-oss to validate **env** files

<small class="text-primary font-bold text-sm">_Why use T3 Env?_</small>

- type-safe environment variables

- Validating envs are quite easy and can be done in a few lines of code

- Support for multiple environments

<LinkButton href="https://env.t3.gg/" variant={"outline"}>
  T3 Env Documentation
</LinkButton>
